projectPurpose: To provide highly-accurate, haplotype-aware error correction for long Nanopore R10.4.1 and R9.4.1 reads using deep learning.
mainFeatures: Highly-accurate error correction
Haplotype-aware correction
Utilizes deep learning (CNNs and self-attention)
Optimized for Nanopore R10.4.1 and R9.4.1 reads
Recommended for reads >= 10 kbps

alternatives.name: Medaka
alternatives.license: Open Source - Oxford Nanopore Technologies Public License Version 1.0
mainFeatures: Consensus sequence generation (polishing)
Requires only basecalled data
Uses neural networks
Improved accuracy over graph-based methods (e.g., Racon)
GPU support for faster processing

alternatives.name: Canu
mainFeatures: De novo assembly of noisy reads
Includes a read correction step
Overlap-based error correction
Handles varying coverage levels
Designed for PacBio and Nanopore reads

alternatives.name: wtdbg2
mainFeatures: De novo assembly for long noisy reads
Builds consensus from intermediate assembly
Fast assembly speed
Uses a fuzzy Bruijn graph approach
Handles PacBio and Nanopore data

alternatives.name: LoRDEC
mainFeatures: Hybrid error correction (uses short reads to correct long reads)
Builds a de Bruijn graph from short reads
Seeks corrective sequences in the graph
Efficient in terms of speed and memory
Can be used for PacBio and Nanopore reads

alternatives.name: LoRMA
mainFeatures: Self-correction for long reads
Iteratively uses LoRDEC for local correction
Uses long-range sequence similarity for correction
Clusters similar reads to detect similarity
Handles PacBio and Nanopore reads

alternatives.name: NanoReviser
mainFeatures: Error correction for Nanopore sequencing
Based on a deep learning algorithm
Aims to improve accuracy of MinION reads
Does not require short-read sequences
First reported standalone Nanopore error correction tool based on deep learning

alternatives.name: DeChat
mainFeatures: Error correction for Nanopore R10 reads
Repeat- and haplotype-aware correction
Combines de Bruijn graphs and variant-aware multiple sequence alignment
Avoids read overcorrection
Designed for high accuracy or super accuracy basecalled reads

marketPositioning: HERRO is positioned as a specialized, high-accuracy, haplotype-aware error correction tool for the latest generation of ultra-long Nanopore reads (R10.4.1/R9.4.1 >= 10 kbps). While other tools like Medaka, Canu, and wtdbg2 offer general Nanopore error correction or polishing, HERRO differentiates itself through its explicit focus on haplotype preservation in long reads and its specific deep-learning architecture. This makes it particularly valuable for applications like phased genome assembly where maintaining accurate representation of both haplotypes is crucial. It competes with other deep learning-based tools like NanoReviser and haplotype-aware correctors like DeChat, emphasizing its blend of accuracy, haplotype awareness, and optimization for current ultra-long read data.
